lead_paragraph: The two countries are digging in for a battle that will continue regardless of any peace deal: the fight against the Islamic State extremist group.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Helene Cooper from Brussels, and Michael S. Schmidt from Paris.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and ERIC SCHMITT

headline.print_headline: Russia and U.S., While Pushing Peace Talks, Compete for Allies in Syria
headline.main: Russia and U.S., While Pushing for Peace Talks, Jockey for Position in Syria

snippet: The two countries are digging in for a battle that will continue regardless of any peace deal: the fight against the Islamic State extremist group.
abstract: Russian military increases its presence in Syria, establishing new airfield and opening dialogue with Sunni forces fighting Islamic State; competition with United States for allies on ground comes as diplomatic efforts to achieve cease-fire flounder; two powers' clashing strategies are becoming major obstacle to resolving conflict.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
